Text.Value: There are so many places you've yet to explore, and not much time left to see them. Better get started.
$*The netherbrain is defeated, Faer√ªn is saved, but where you should feel peace you feel only the orb. Restless. Hungry. Yearning.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gale stands at a window, looking out over the Chionthar. If possible, a shot of the Chionthar.

Text.Value: *The Crown is in the depths of the Chionthar, waiting for your summons. You have the means to reforge it, and revive the power of Netheril anew.*

EditorData.NodeContext: Speaking of Gale, a mind flayer, who knows that he could reforge the Crown of Karsus - the very thing that allowed the Netherbrain to be dominated and become the Netherbrain
EditorData.logicalname: ILLITHID GALE KNOWS ABOUT REFORGING + MET MYSTRA

Text.Value: *You could take the Crown to Mystra, perhaps leverage it for a cure. But there is no guarantee that she will be in a forgiving mood.*

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale weighing internally pros and cons of interacting with Mystra at this critical juncture

Text.Value: *Waterdeep is waiting for you - it's time to go home.*
*You felt the magic of Karsus draining from the stones as the Crown plummeted to the bottom of the Chionthar. A useless trinket, nothing more.*
$*You are an illithid, your body ravaged by ceremorphosis, your mind prey to unfamiliar desires to consume, to devour.*
*Or... you could take control of it for yourself, and become a god.*

EditorData.NodeContext: Speculating on the other path Gale could take (the ambitious one) - becoming a god and having absolute power

Text.Value: *The very air around you thrums with anticipation, and fear. Can you really handle such power, such authority?*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gale contemplating his newfound power, feeling his isolation from his surroundings and his party
EditorData.NodeContext: speaking of Gale, who is fairly sure he's about to become a god
EditorData.SFXTags: power dancing in the palm of Gale
EditorData.VFXTags: power dancing in the palm of Gale

Text.Value: Seek out Elminster's counsel - perhaps there's still a way to stabilise the orb for good.
$*Within you, the orb strains against its confines. You sense Elminster's enchantment is beginning to fade. It will not be contained much longer, but that doesn't matter now.*
Reforge the Crown. Offer it to Mystra, hope that it's enough for her to cure you of the orb.
Reforge the Crown. Offer it to Mystra, hope that it's enough for her to cure you of the orb.
*Mystra's summons still stands. Bring the Crown to her and she may yet offer you a cure, but there is no guarantee that she will be in a forgiving mood.*

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Knows Mystra wants to speak to you
EditorData.NodeContext: Gale weighing internally pros and cons of doing what Mystra says

Text.Value: $*And what of the orb? Already you sense Elminster's enchantment fading. Will you still be able to prevent its explosion when you can barely control yourself?*
*One way or another, you will have to reckon with your god. It's time to speak to Mystra.*

EditorData.NodeContext: The moment before Gale speaks to his god, Mystra

Text.Value: You will return the Crown of Karsus to Mystra. She may yet see fit to redeem you.
You will return the Crown of Karsus to Mystra. She may yet see fit to redeem you.
What does it matter? You're a mind flayer. This world is yours.
*You've always been curious about Menzoberranzan - perhaps that would be a good place to start. And after that, Cormyr, or even the Feywild.*

EditorData.stateContext: Gale stands at a window, gazing out contemplatively.

Text.Value: *Your fate will be what you make of it. Now, you are your own master.*
*Of one thing you may be assured - the world will be safe from the Crown's power, thanks to you - the illithid that defeated a Netherbrain.*

EditorData.NodeContext: morally good outcome for Gale who made sacrifices

Text.Value: You will claim the Crown of Karsus. It is your right. Your destiny.
You will claim the Crown of Karsus. It is your right. Your destiny.
*There's only one way to find out.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gale, determined, the course is set
EditorData.SFXTags: dispatch the power cast in his palm
EditorData.VFXTags: dispatch the power cast in his palm

Text.Value: *You will be immortalised in legend - generations upon generations will celebrate the tale of Gale of Waterdeep - the wizard that defeated a Netherbrain.*
You've been away too long and left too many books unread. Your library is calling.
*Perhaps Mystra will recognise you for your humility, perhaps not.*
*Already you feel the orb straining against the confines of Elminster's spell. It will not hold forever. How will you spend the time that you have left?*

EditorData.stateContext: Gale stands at a window, gazing out contemplatively.

Text.Value: *The Crown is in the depths of the Chionthar. If you salvage the stones, you could claim it, reforge it, and revive the power of Netheril anew.*

EditorData.NodeContext: Speaking of Gale, who knows that he could reforge the Crown of Karsus - the very thing that allowed the Netherbrain to be dominated and become the Netherbrain

Text.Value: *Of one thing you may be assured - the world will be safe from the Crown's power, thanks to you - Gale of Waterdeep, the wizard who defeated a Netherbrain.*
*Perhaps the Underdark. With your death, you might even eradicate others of your kind from the face of this realm.*

EditorData.logicalname: SUICIDE BUT NOT IN THIS MOMENT

Text.Value: $*At last, the future unfolds before you. The power of Karsus in your hands. And no one, not the orb, not even the goddess of magic herself, is going to stop you.*

EditorData.NodeContext: The orb is most definitely going to stop you, so maybe a hint of irony to the player's confidence here

Text.Value: *You could start with Oryndoll, and perhaps later, Glyth itself. The world is yours to uncover, its stories yours to tell.*
*At least the mortal world will be safe from the temptation of the Crown. But you...*
*Not to mention a comfy armchair, a roaring fire, and a glass of fine wine.*
You're an illithid now - new worlds are yours to explore, for as long as you still live.

EditorData.logicalname: Alias (ILLITHID GALE KNOWS ABOUT REFORGING + MET MYSTRA)

Text.Value: It's time the Crown had a new owner - you. The illithid that defeated the Netherbrain.
It's time the Crown had a new owner - you. The wizard that defeated the Netherbrain.
Someone should write of your adventures. What better biographer can there be than you?
$*The netherbrain is defeated, Faer√ªn is saved, but where you should feel peace within there is only anticipation, for the new day holds the promise of something greater still.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gale stands at a window, looking out over the Chionthar. If possible, a shot of the Chionthar.

Text.Value: The risk to others is too great. You will have to take your life. But somewhere far away from here.
*Once the Crown is restored, you could return it to Mystra, fulfilling her wishes, and ridding the mortal world of such temptation.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale is speculating one path he could take (the morally good one)

Text.Value: *No doubt the Old Mage will have much to say about your adventures, and you will have much to tell him. The only problem is - where to find him?*
*Whyever not? After all, you are an illithid - whatever flaws plagued you as a human are long behind you now.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gale in Illithid form, flexing his Illithid magic, interwoven with Karsite magic
EditorData.SFXTags: power dancing in the palm of Gale tranforming or mixing with the illithis one
EditorData.VFXTags: power dancing in the palm of Gale tranforming or mixing with the illithis one

Text.Value: *You have thwarted the illithid Grand Design. You have defeated three Chosen and a Netherbrain. You are miraculous, and you have earned the right to live.*
*The Karsite Weave palpates within you - stirred by the very prospect.*

EditorData.NodeContext: the power within Gale resonating at the prospect of more power

Synopsis:
Avatar Gale has a moment of reflection by himself in a room in the elfsong tavern, shortly after the battle for Baldur's Gate and defeat of the Netherbrain. 

This dialogue serves to offer the chance to decide the crown's fate for players who didn't get the chance to do this in combat over. It reuses a lot of lines from that dialogue VO-wise, but cinematically feel free to adjust the shots/poses as needed.
